channel.title: Outpost: A Star Trek Fan Production
channel.description: Star Trek Audio Drama from Giant Gnome Productions. Life is good for Lt. Greg Torkelson aboard the USS Remington a Starfleet research vessel stationed near the Venderis Nebula. However, when word comes that he’s been promoted to the Executive Officer of Deep Space Station 3, an outpost in the backwaters of Federation space, he quickly discovers that all is not as it appears, and what seems to be too good to be true just might be. ” In the darkest reaches of the United Federation of Planets, an isolated station stands sentinel over a neglected frontier. Commissioned long ago with high hopes, its promise is now all but forgotten; a lonely outpost serving as the gateway to the vast expanse beyond, where discovery…and adventure…await..”- Lt. Commander Gregory Torkelson

item.title: Outpost – Episode 82A – Slippery
item.description:
Deep Space 3 has some Deep Space 3 has some strange visitors to the station who claim to have come from the far side of the Pinchot Expanse -- and they bring a mysterious gift with them.

The post Outpost – Episode 82A – Slippery appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Outpost – Episode 82A – Slippery

Release Date: June 15, 2022

Listen Now

Deep Space 3 has some Deep Space 3 has some strange visitors to the station who claim to have come from the far side of the Pinchot Expanse — and they bring a mysterious gift with them.

Cast and Crew (In Order of Appearance)

Written by David R. Long. Produced, directed and audio engineered by Daniel McIntosh and Tony Raymond. Recorded live at Starfest 2022 in Denver, Colorado.

In order of appearance, the cast for this episode featured the voice talents of:

Lincoln Thomas as Captain Xyier
Greg Woods as Commander Kon
Randall Bryant at Ensign Sirak
Riese Devan as Ensign Williams
Leah Rosenberg as Ensign Loren
and Edward Winterrose as Captain Montaine Buchanan

FEATURING: Original Music provided courtesy of: Matthew McLaren from S&M Productions; Kevin MacLeod from Incompetech.com, Jared Cowing, and Daniel Madden.

Announcer: Paul Lavelle
Writers/Directors/Producers/Audio Engineers: Daniel McIntosh and Tony Raymond

The post Outpost – Episode 82A – Slippery appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.

item.title: Outpost – Episode 82 – Of Demons and Angels
item.description:
As the USS Chimera undergoes repairs at Wolf 359, DS3 has become a destination for wayward travelers opportunistic entrepreneurs, and those who wish to take advantage of the absences of the station's two starships during the Federation-wide alert.

The post Outpost – Episode 82 – Of Demons and Angels appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Outpost – Episode 82 – Of Demons and Angels

Release Date: March 5, 2022

Listen Now

item.title: Outpost – Episode 80 – This Hallowed Space – Part II
item.description:
Having encountered pirates scavenging the lifeless hulks of the destroyed Federation armada at Wolf 359 after the Borg incursion, the crew of U.S.S. Chimera struggles valiantly to fend off the intruders. Complicating matters is the defense of the hospital ship Errand of Mercy, and a shuttlecraft carrying crew and injured Starfleet personnel from the wreckage. Has the Chimera anything left to give? Will she join the ranks of the dead hulks at Wolf 359?

The post Outpost – Episode 80 – This Hallowed Space – Part II appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.

Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Complicating matters is the defense of the hospital ship Errand of Mercy, and a shuttlecraft carrying crew and injured Starfleet personnel from the wreckage. Has the Chimera anything left to give? item.title: Outpost – Episode 79A – Look, Don’t Touch
item.description:
The Battle of Wolf 359 has begun...beam aboard a ship valiantly trying to defend the Federation during this turning point in Federation history.

The post Outpost – Episode 79A – Look, Don’t Touch appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Outpost – Episode 79A – Look, Don’t Touch

Release Date: March 25, 2020

Listen Now

When a group of supply clerks are granted access to Chimera’s engineering section, they find that curiosity is not a good thing. Recorded at Starfest 2019, Denver, Colorado.

Cast and Crew (In Order of Appearance)

Written by David R. Long

Produced, directed and audio engineered by Daniel McIntosh and Tony Raymond.

In order of appearance, the cast for Version 1 of this episode featured the voice talents of:

  • Lawrence Mack as Lt. Mack
  • Ellie Tolces as Yeoman Rau
  • Ken Dalmadge as Yeoman Yeager
  • Stephen Cooper as Yeoman King
  • Riese Devan as Yeoman West
  • Myka Raymond as The Computer
  • Jon Specht as Chief Burt Knox

Not featured in this episode, but serving as stand-ins during the recording were:

Brian Thomas as The Computer and John Baker as Chief Burt Knox

In order of appearance, the cast for Version 2 of this episode featured the voice talents of:

  • Riese Devan as Lt. Mack
  • Ken Dalmadge as Yeoman Rau
  • Ellie Tolces as Yeoman Yeager
  • Brian Thomas as Yeoman King
  • Lawrence Mack as Yeoman West
  • Myka Raymond as The Computer
  • John Specht as Chief Burt Knox

Not featured in this episode, but serving as stand-ins during the recording were:

  • Greg Woods as The Computer
  • Stephen Cooper as Chief Burt Knox

FEATURING ORIGINAL MUSIC BY:

  • Matthew McLaren from S&M Productions
  • Kevin MacLeod from Incompetech.com
  • Jared Cowing

Announcer: Paul Lavelle
Directors/Producers/Audio Engineers: Daniel McIntosh and Tony Raymond

The post Outpost – Episode 79A – Look, Don’t Touch appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.

item.description:
When the USS Watterson visits a planet known as Gift, they discover a world faced with a challenge its inhabitants are unwilling to face...one, that if not confronted soon, will spell certain doom for all life on the planet.

The post Outpost – Episode 78C – Hand of Responsibility appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Outpost – Episode 78C – Hand of Responsibility

Release Date: April 23, 2019

Listen Now


When the USS Watterson visits a planet known as Gift, they discover a world faced with a challenge its inhabitants are unwilling to face…one, that if not confronted soon,  will spell certain doom for all life on the planet.

This minisode was recorded live at Fort Collins Comic Con in Fort Collins, CO in August 2018.

Cast and Crew (In Order of Appearance)

Written, produced, directed and audio engineered by Daniel McIntosh and Tony Raymond.

In order of appearance, the cast for this episode featured the voice talents of:

  • Kelsey Day as Zeydoon
  • Marvin Guggemos as Drazar
  • Liz Leonard as Tarker
  • Lee Montgomery as Goppy
  • Eric Leonard as Captain Hobbes and
  • Awyn Leonard as Lt. Calvin

FEATURING: Original Music provided courtesy of: Matthew McLaren from S&M Productions; Kevin MacLeod from Incompetech.com, and Jared Cowing.

Announcer: Paul Lavelle

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 68 – Illusion of Life
item.description:
The Chimera continues her pursuit of the Remington, but the crew begins to fall victim to the strange energies of the Pinch. Meanwhile, the crew of DS3 confronts Captain Buchanan about his "odd behavior."

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 68 – Illusion of Life appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

The Chimera continues her pursuit of the Remington, but the crew begins to fall victim to the strange energies of the Pinch. Meanwhile, the crew of DS3 confronts Captain Buchanan about his “odd behavior.”

item.description:
Now that Vurk and Tirgil have achieved a certain level of success aboard Deep Space Three, they are looking for an apprentice...or two...or three. They soon discover that the process of finding just the right person for the job is more difficult than it seems.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 61 – Window of Heaven
item.description:
The USS Chimera takes the new Starfleet prototype probe to the Ajax Anomaly and deploys it as instructed. However, when the probe is destroyed by a mysterious alien emerging from the anomaly, the crew finds themselves confronted with a mystery bigger than the anomaly itself.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 54 – The Inside Man
item.description:
The search continues for Betty's parents, but her situation seems to raise more questions than answers. Meanwhile Chief Knox takes Engineer Graves under his wing and starts showing him how to take advantage of "opportunities."

item.content:encoded:

item.description:
A sonic blast designed to rid the station of alien insects may have eliminated the immediate threat...but the cure may have been worse than the disease; when the station's matter/antimatter reactors overload on restart, the crew of DS3 must race against time to restore power and life support -- or face almost certain death.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Behind the Scenes Special – Part I
item.description:
Disregarding the warnings to ignore the people behind the curtain, the fans have spoken...and we have responded with our first Behind the Scenes episode of Star Trek: Outpost. In this special episode, we'll hear from the show's creators, Dan McIntosh and Tony Raymond, who will delve into how the show got started, where the inspiration for the characters came from and more. You'll also hear from Edward Winterrose, Ben Cromey and Doug Cromey as they talk about their perspectives on the show, their characters and their acting experiences.

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Behind the Scenes Special – Part I appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Star Trek: Outpost – Behind the Scenes- Part I

Release Date: November 1, 2012

Listen Now

Disregarding the warnings to ignore the people behind the curtain, the fans have spoken…and we have responded with our first Behind the Scenes episode of Star Trek: Outpost. In this special episode, we’ll hear from the show’s creators, Dan McIntosh and Tony Raymond, who will delve into how the show got started, where the inspiration for the characters came from and more. You’ll also hear from Edward Winterrose, Ben Cromey and Doug Cromey as they talk about their perspectives on the show, their characters and their acting experiences.

Many Kudos

The Producers of Star Trek: Outpost would like to thank the entire cast for making this show possible…it is completely on their talent that we have lived long and prospered!

Special Thanks

Special Thanks to Paul Lavelle and RC Thorne for their extra effort in making this episode a success!

FEATURING: Original Music Composed and Performed by Matthew McLaren from S&M Productions; Additional Music Provided by Kevin MacLeod at Incompetech.com.

Writers/Directors/Producers/Audio Engineers: Daniel McIntosh and Tony Raymond
Executive Producer: Waleed Ovase

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Behind the Scenes Special – Part I appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.

Now that Captain Buchanan and Lt. Exler have been found, only Commander Torkelson and his team remain unaccounted for. Meanwhile, Lt. Forrestal and Chief Knox develop a risky plan to get rid of the bugs...once and for all.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 35A – What Lies Hidden
item.description:
Participants from the 2012 Starfest Science Fiction Convention in Denver helped put together this special edition episode. In this vignette, go back to the last days of the USS Leone...a decommissioned Oberth-class vessel destined for salvage at Deep Space 3. Only, not is all as it appears...for the ship has a hidden secret....one that could prove deadly to the station...and its crew.

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 35A – What Lies Hidden appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 35A – What Lies Hidden

Release Date: May 15, 2012

Listen Now

Participants from the 2012 Starfest Science Fiction Convention in Denver helped put together this special edition episode. In this vignette, go back to the last days of the USS Leone: a decommissioned Oberth-class vessel destined for salvage at Deep Space 3. Only, not is all as it appears, for the ship has a hidden secret. One that could prove deadly to the station and its crew.

Cast and Crew (In Order of Appearance)

Max Cooper as Lieutenant Dull
CC Petersen as Captain Baker
Julie Nakao as Ensign B-9
Audrey Graham as Starbase Controller
Craig Banister as Engineer Bright
Dan McIntosh as Engineer Sigourney
Paul Lavelle as Engineer Weaver
Chris Cree as Engineer Tree
Jennifer Redelle Carey as Engineer Shiny

Based on a story by Charles Bowman

Having found Goshen dead inside a bulkhead in the disused plaza area of Deep Space 3, Lt. Farmer launches an investigation into his mysterious death – and EVERYONE aboard the station is a suspect!

item.description:

item.title: Parsec Message 2010
item.description:
Tony and Dan were at Dragon*Con this afternoon at the Parsec Awards Ceremony, and unfortunately Star Trek: Outpost did not win a Parsec Award this year.

The post Parsec Message 2010 appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Tony and Dan were at Dragon*Con this afternoon at the Parsec Awards Ceremony, and unfortunately Star Trek: Outpost did not win a Parsec Award this year.

Tony, Dan, and myself (Waleed) would like to thank everyone for listening to Star Trek: Outpost, and supporting it through the past few years.

Please enjoy “Episode 17: Enter theÂ Sovereignty” which has been released a few hours early.

A special message from Tony and Dan will be posted soon. Â Again, we’d like to thank everyone for listening to Star Trek: Outpost, supporting it and Giant Gnome Productions throughout the years, it has been greatly appreciated. Â We hope to be doing this for many years to come.

The post Parsec Message 2010 appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.dc:creator: Giant Gnome Productions

item.title: A Parsec Message from Tony and Dan
item.description:
Here at Giant Gnome Productions, we're exceptionally happy that one of our great shows was picked to be a Parsec Finalist. Tony and Dan have crafted a special message to our faithful listeners. If you're going to Dragon*Con, please be sure to scout out Tony and Dan who will be wearing Giant Gnome Productions t-shirts and say hi. We always love to meet our listeners. As always, thanks for listening.

The post A Parsec Message from Tony and Dan appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Here at Giant Gnome Productions, we’re exceptionally happy that one of our great shows was picked to be a Parsec Finalist. Â Tony and Dan have crafted a special message to our faithful listeners. Â If you’re going to Dragon*Con, please be sure to scout out Tony and Dan who will be wearing Giant Gnome Productions t-shirts and say hi. Â We always love to meet our listeners. As always, thanks for listening.

If you’re coming, please leave a comment, we’d love to hear from you at the convention!

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 16 – Shadow of the Standard Bearer

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 15 – Ambush
item.description:
The Chimera must abandon its search for Lt. Exler when it is diverted to the Glaminfo, a spacegoing entertainment oasis, to rendezvous with a Ferengi transport. And while Exler and Tyrellian engage in a life-and-death struggle with the Klingon Jenneth, Captain Britarra and the Solar Winds patiently lie in wait...

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 12 – Slips, Strips, Bars & Bricks
item.description:
The Chimera finally emerges from the Rough Seas and begins the desperate search for their lost crewmate. Back on DS3, a mysterious Ferengi Treasury Agent makes a demand of Captain Buchanan that may seal Exler's fate -- and that of the Chimera's former commander.

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 12 – Slips, Strips, Bars & Bricks appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 12 – Slips, Strips, Bars and Bricks (season 2 premiere)

Release Date: April 5, 2010

Listen Now

After being delayed in their pursuit of the pirate ship Solar Winds, the crew of the Chimera finally emerges from the Rough Seas and begins the desperate search for their lost crewmate. Meanwhile, back on DS3, a mysterious Ferengi Treasury Agent makes a demand of Captain Buchanan that may seal Exler’s fate — and that of the Chimera’s former commander.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 11 – Into The Rough Seas
item.description:
After hastily leaving port, the crew of the Chimera heads to join in the search and rescue of the Ferengi shuttle carrying Lt. Exler, Dr. Winston and Goshen. Meanwhile the pirates of the Solar Winds continue their pursuit, driving the shuttle further into the ion storm known as the Rough Seas. Will the Chimera find their missing crewmates, or will the pirates emerge victorious in this dangerous game of cat and mouse? Find out now...in the Season One Finale of Star Trek: Outpost!

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 11 – Into The Rough Seas appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 10 – Uneasy Reunions
item.description:
Giant Gnome Productions is proud to announce the latest episode of the Original Star Trek Audio Drama: Star Trek: Outpost - Episode 10 - Uneasy Reunions. On the return trip from the Enclave, Dr. Winston and Lt. Exler discover they've got more than they bargained for when they uncover Goshen's secret. Meanwhile, back on DS3, Tork's awaited charge arrives at the station, along with an old friend who's been reassigned to the Chimera.

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 8 – A Little Give and Take
item.description:
While Chief Knox directs the Admiral's engineers in repairing the Chimera, Dr. Winston receives a "unique" gift that leads her, Goshen and Lt. Exler to the Enclave - a dangerous pirate haven on the edge of the Pinch - to learn more about Esherite technology and the Chief's unauthorized implant.

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 8 – A Little Give and Take appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Giant Gnome Productions presents…

Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 8 – A Little Give and Take

Release Date: November 5, 2009

Listen Now

While Chief Knox directs the Admiral’s engineers in repairing the Chimera, Dr. Winston receives a “unique” gift that leads her, Goshen and Lt. Exler to the Enclave – a dangerous pirate haven on the edge of the Pinch – to learn more about Esherite technology and the Chief’s unauthorized implant.

Cast and Crew

Robert Pepper as Lt. Commander Greg Torkelson

item.title: Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 2 – From Bad To Worse
item.description:
Episode 2 - From Bad To Worse: Inside the mysterious area of space known as "The Pinch," Lt. Exler and Dr. Winston have taken an away team aboard the doomed Ferengi ship Profitable Venture in search of survivors. Just as the last of the away team is about to beam back, the Ferengi vessel explodes, crippling the Chimera. Adrift among a sea of debris, the Chimera now sits nearly defenseless as her crew works desperately to repair the ship and return to the safety of DS3. The crew soon discovers, however, that they are not alone...

The post Star Trek: Outpost – Episode 2 – From Bad To Worse appeared first on Giant Gnome Productions.

Inside the mysterious area of space known as “The Pinch,” Lt. Exler and Dr. Winston have taken an away team aboard the doomed Ferengi ship Profitable Venture in search of survivors. Just as the last of the away team is about to beam back, the Ferengi vessel explodes, crippling the Chimera. Adrift among a sea of debris, the Chimera now sits nearly defenseless as her crew works desperately to repair the ship and return to the safety of DS3. The crew soon discovers, however, that they are not alone…
